text: Trent Dilfer (b. March 13, 1972) is the current head coach of the UAB (Alabama-Birmingham) football team and formerly an ESPN analyst and former American football quarterback. He played in the NFL for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers (1993-1999), Baltimore Ravens, (2000), Seattle Seahawks (2001-2004), Cleveland Browns (2005), and San Francisco 49ers (2006-2007). The only time Dilfer did not play in a season in his career was 2006 with San Francisco. During his career, Dilfer has been criticized for bad throwing. He did, however, win Super Bowl XXXV with the Ravens. He is famous for the conservative offense he was in with the Ravens in 2000, where he replaced Tony Banks. ==References== Category:American football quarterbacks Category:Tampa Bay Buccaneers players Category:Baltimore Ravens players Category:Seattle Seahawks players Category:Cleveland Browns players Category:San Francisco 49ers players Category:Football players from California Category:1972 births Category:Living people
title: Trent Dilfer
